page.title: 05WALESBY PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: The school in Walesby is a Church of England Voluntary Controlled Primary School. Although there has been a school in the village since 1878 the present building was started in 1966, being completed to its present size of six teaching areas in three stages. There are approximately 180 children, aged from 4+ to 11, on roll with a staff consisting of headteacher, seven teaching staff, secretary, caretaker, 5 kitchen staff and 3 lunch-time welfare assistants. There are also visiting peripatetic staff for specialist music and drama work. The school has a number of resources including T.V., video and four BBC computers. The children in the school travel in from a number of villages including Walesby, Kirton, Haughton, Perlethorpe, Bothamsall, Tuxford, Wellow, Boughton and Ollerton.
